page.title: 03Snape Castle, North Yorks.
page.content: As you approach Snape from the main road, you come down an imposing avenue of lime trees, and at the end of the trees is a castle. The present building dates from the fifteenth century and occupies the site of an older Manor House. Under the castle there are no foundations, only huge oaken piles 12 feet long and 8 feet in diameter which are about 700 years old. The Neville family owned Snape and the castle until 1798.Catherine Parr, the last wife of Henry VIII,lived here when she was married to her second husband,the 3rd Lord Latimer of Snape.Most of the castle is in ruins,but the South Wing forms two private residences.The chapel in the castle is used for Sunday Services and is the only part open to the public.
